questions.question: What is the primary purpose of web standards?
choices: To make websites look visually appealing
To ensure consistency and interoperability across platforms
questions.answer: To ensure consistency and interoperability across platforms

questions.question: Which organization is primarily responsible for developing and maintaining web standards?
questions.answer: W3C

questions.question: What does HTML validation check for?
questions.answer: Compliance with official HTML standards

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common benefit of adhering to web standards?
questions.answer: Increased website traffic

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS validation?
choices: To check for proper color combinations
To ensure CSS code complies with official standards
To optimize CSS for faster loading
To convert CSS to a minified version
questions.answer: To ensure CSS code complies with official standards

questions.question: Which of the following is a common validation error in HTML?
choices: Having more than one h1 element
questions.answer: Unclosed elements

questions.question: What does cross-browser compatibility refer to?
choices: The ability of a website to function on both desktop and mobile devices
The consistency of a website's appearance and functionality across different web browsers
The speed at which a website loads on different browsers
The ability to view a website in multiple languages
questions.answer: The consistency of a website's appearance and functionality across different web browsers

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a major web browser rendering engine?
questions.answer: Lynx

questions.question: What is a key strategy for ensuring cross-browser compatibility?
choices: Using browser-specific CSS prefixes for all properties
Implementing feature detection instead of browser detection
Developing separate versions of the website for each browser
Using only basic HTML without any CSS or JavaScript
questions.answer: Implementing feature detection instead of browser detection

questions.question: Why is website performance optimization important?
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is minification in the context of web development?
choices: Reducing the number of pages on a website
Removing unnecessary characters from code without changing its functionality
Compressing images to smaller file sizes
questions.answer: Removing unnecessary characters from code without changing its functionality

questions.question: Which image format is generally best for photographs on the web?
questions.answer: JPEG

questions.question: What is the purpose of browser caching?
choices: To save frequently accessed resources locally on the user's device
To prevent users from accessing outdated content
To track user behavior across different websites
questions.answer: To save frequently accessed resources locally on the user's device

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical performance optimization technique?
choices: Increasing the number of HTTP requests
questions.answer: Increasing the number of HTTP requests

questions.question: What does 'above the fold' refer to in web design?
choices: The header section of a webpage
The footer section of a webpage
questions.answer: Content visible without scrolling

questions.question: How does adhering to web standards improve accessibility?
choices: By ensuring proper structure for screen readers
questions.answer: By ensuring proper structure for screen readers

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the W3C HTML validator?
choices: To optimize HTML for search engines
To identify and report HTML syntax errors and warnings
questions.answer: To identify and report HTML syntax errors and warnings

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using semantic HTML?
questions.answer: Improved search engine optimization

questions.question: What is progressive enhancement in web development?
choices: Gradually adding new features to a website over time
Building a basic functional experience for all users, then enhancing for modern browsers
Using the latest web technologies regardless of browser support
Focusing on mobile design before desktop
questions.answer: Building a basic functional experience for all users, then enhancing for modern browsers

questions.question: Why is it important to use feature detection instead of browser detection?
choices: It future-proofs code against new browser versions
It allows for more complex JavaScript
questions.answer: It future-proofs code against new browser versions

questions.question: What is the purpose of a CSS reset?
choices: To remove all styles from a webpage
To set default styles for all HTML elements
To minimize browser inconsistencies in default styling
To optimize CSS for faster loading
questions.answer: To minimize browser inconsistencies in default styling

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a web standard?
questions.answer: PHP

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using a Content Delivery Network (CDN)?
choices: It reduces server load and improves loading speed for geographically dispersed users
questions.answer: It reduces server load and improves loading speed for geographically dispersed users

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid reason to use inline CSS?
choices: To reduce the number of HTTP requests for critical above-the-fold content
To make the website load faster overall
questions.answer: To reduce the number of HTTP requests for critical above-the-fold content

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an img tag?
choices: To provide a title for the image
To provide alternative text for screen readers and when the image fails to load
To improve the image's search engine ranking
questions.answer: To provide alternative text for screen readers and when the image fails to load

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using external CSS files?
choices: Better separation of content and presentation
questions.answer: Improved page loading speed

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) attributes?
choices: To enhance the visual design of web applications
To provide additional information for assistive technologies
To optimize websites for mobile devices
questions.answer: To provide additional information for assistive technologies

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of responsive web design?
choices: Designing separately for mobile and desktop
Using fluid grids and flexible images
Avoiding the use of CSS media queries
questions.answer: Using fluid grids and flexible images

questions.question: What is the main purpose of using a doctype declaration in HTML?
choices: To specify the character encoding of the document
To tell the browser which version of HTML the page is using
questions.answer: To tell the browser which version of HTML the page is using

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common technique for optimizing website performance?
choices: Using multiple small images instead of sprites
questions.answer: Using multiple small images instead of sprites
